Name: Copy as JS expression
Description: Can I copy a node's path to be used as a JavaScript expression?

Chrome.References: [1] Copy JS path, by Chrome DevTools [Docs](https://developer.chrome.com/blog/new-in-devtools-72/#copy)
Chrome.Notes: 1. In the **Elements** tab, right click on the node in the DOM tree > Copy > Copy JS path. This will copy the query selector to the node that can be used in the JS code.
Chrome.Name: Copy as JS expression

Edge.Notes: 1. In the **Elements** tab, right click on the node in the DOM tree > Copy > Copy JS path. This will copy the query selector to the node that can be used in the JS code.
Edge.Name: Copy as JS expression

Opera.Notes: 1. In the **Elements** tab, right click on the node in the DOM tree > Copy > Copy JS path. This will copy the query selector to the node that can be used in the JS code.
Opera.Name: Copy as JS expression
